Alan.goal: Schedule a 30-minute meeting with all participants on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participants availability and produce a joint 30-minute meeting time on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants.

public_information: Work hours are 09:00 to 17:00 on Monday
All participants must attend the same 30-minute meeting
There exists a solution that fits every participant schedule

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems for the FastDownward solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that model your availability and constraints. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is Alan. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information}. You have the following knowledge: {agents->Alan->private_information}. This is the global goal to solve: {agents->Alan->goal}. Produce PDDL domain and PDDL problem files for FastDownward that encode your availability and constraints. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Think step by step and do not make assumptions beyond your knowledge.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems for the FastDownward solver. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that integrate other agents PDDL fragments and produce a joint plan. You always enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, keep their actions distinct.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. There are multiple agents planning to schedule a meeting. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. Your goal is to integrate their PDDL outputs to produce a single PDDL domain and PDDL problem for FastDownward that yields a 30-minute meeting time on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all. Keep in mind that agent PDDL fragments may be partial or use different names for the same time slots. You must keep actions of different agents distinct and resolve naming or ambiguity issues when integrating. Here is Alan PDDL: {pddl_Alan}. Here is Michael PDDL: {pddl_Michael}. Here is Michelle PDDL: {pddl_Michelle}. Here is Roy PDDL: {pddl_Roy}. Here is Judy PDDL: {pddl_Judy}. Here is Natalie PDDL: {pddl_Natalie}. Here is Brian PDDL: {pddl_Brian}. Think step by step and provide a unified PDDL domain and PDDL problem that FastDownward can solve. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
